text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the DUP's opposition to the Protocol, linking it directly to the issue of customs checks in the Irish Sea. Section 4.3, 'Why the DUP cared,' states: 'The Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has long argued that the original Protocol turned NI into a \u201cborder in the Irish Sea\u201d. The Stormont Brake gives the DUP... a political veto over new EU regulations that would increase the regulatory burden on GB-NI trade. When the DUP boycotted the Assembly... they were protesting the lack of any such veto. The inclusion of the brake in the Windsor Framework was a key concession that made it possible for the DUP to return to Stormont in early 2023.'
